title: Emmerdale star Matthew Wolfenden has opened about losing his friend to suicide
text:
Emmerdale star Matthew Wolfenden has opened about recently losing his friend to suicide.

With World Mental Health Day on the horizon, Matthew — who plays David Metcalfe in the hit ITV soap — took to Instagram yesterday to share a personal message.

The image, which he simply captioned with ‘#worldmentalhealthday2019’, mentioned how he lost a friend to suicide ‘only 3 weeks ago’.

In the image, he said: ‘As someone who has openly talked about my battles over the years with depression, I thought it only proper to put a little post out there on such an important day #worldmentalhealthday2019.’

‘Only 3 weeks ago I lost a friend to suicide, he was 52 and outwardly the happiest, funniest, friendliest man you could meet. You never know what someone is going through on the inside’.

He finished out the message by encouraging readers to ‘talk about mental health’, saying: ‘Don’t be embarrassed about talking about mental health. Be open, talk, it WILL help.’

Fans were quick to post their messages of support below, with one saying: ‘Sending lots of love xxx’ while another commented ‘So sad and so true. Well said’, with another adding: ‘So sorry for your loss. Thankyou for sharing’.

Matthew has been at the centre of Emmerdale as of late, with his character David featuring heavily in the recent food-poisoning narrative, as well as the grooming storyline which saw David’s son Jacob (Joe-Warren Plant) groomed by teacher Maya Stepney (Louisa Clein).
